name: the wind in the oak tree
notes:
**this sock pattern was designed for the sock knitters anonymous group for the january 2024 mystery sock, mock. it fits the flora/fauna theme**.

the pattern is divided into four clues to be released on 1, 8, 15, and 22 january 2024.
because it is designed as a mystery, no photos of the socks are present in any of the clues.

**you will need:**
fingering-weight sock yarn (400-420 m / 100 g):
•	main colour: 80-100 g
•	contrast colour 1: 10 g
•	contrast colour 2: 5-10 g
if you wish, you can use only one contrast yarn, in which case you will need about 15-25 g.

needles: 2.25 mm or size needed to obtain correct gauge, tapestry needle and 2 stitch markers (optional). the pattern is written for magic loop, but you can use dpns or 2 circular needles as well.

**gauge**: 32 sts and 44 rds = 10 cm in stockinette

many thanks for test knitting and proofreading to [gerstperson](/people/gerstperson), [misscellaneous](/people/misscellaneous), [pitsiliina](/people/pitsiliina), [sandysays](/people/sandysays) and [tiiq](/people/tiiq).
